original_solution_mapping.L3: That means the total length of the game is 56/.4=<<56/.4=140>>140 hours

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5609.
    Returns: the number of days until John finishes the game.
    """
    # L1
    days_per_week = 7 # WK
    num_weeks = 2 # 2 weeks
    total_days_played = days_per_week * num_weeks

    # L2
    hours_per_day_initial = 4 # 4 hours a day
    total_hours_played_initial = total_days_played * hours_per_day_initial

    # L3
    percent_done = 0.4 # 40% done
    total_game_length = total_hours_played_initial / percent_done

    # L4
    remaining_hours = total_game_length - total_hours_played_initial

    # L5
    hours_per_day_increased = 7 # 7 hours a day
    days_to_finish = remaining_hours / hours_per_day_increased

    # FA
    answer = days_to_finish
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are {days_per_week}*{num_weeks}=<<{days_per_week}*{num_weeks}={total_days_played}>>{total_days_played} days in two weeks
That means the total length of the game is {total_hours_played_initial}/{percent_done}=<<{total_hours_played_initial}/{percent_done}={total_game_length}>>{total_game_length} hours
So he has {total_game_length}-{total_hours_played_initial}=<<{total_game_length}-{total_hours_played_initial}={remaining_hours}>>{remaining_hours} hours to beat the game
So it will take him {remaining_hours}/{hours_per_day_increased}=<<{remaining_hours}/{hours_per_day_increased}={days_to_finish}>>{days_to_finish} days to beat the game

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: So it will take him 84/14=<<84/14=6>>6 days to beat the game

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'total_days_played' (14) was used instead of 'hours_per_day_increased' (7).
